first_para: Sandra Currie Osborne (née Clark, born 23 February 1956) is a Scottish Labour politician, who has been the Member of Parliament for Ayr, Carrick and Cumnock since 2005. She was first elected in 1997, and resigned from a government job in 2003 over the Iraq War. She was a member of the Foreign Affairs Select Committee from 2005–10 and again from 2013. She was a member of the Defence Select Committee 2010-13 and is a member of the Council of Europe.

full.extract:
Sandra Currie Osborne (née Clark, born 23 February 1956) is a Scottish Labour politician, who has been the Member of Parliament for Ayr, Carrick and Cumnock since 2005. She was first elected in 1997, and resigned from a government job in 2003 over the Iraq War. She was a member of the Foreign Affairs Select Committee from 2005–10 and again from 2013. She was a member of the Defence Select Committee 2010-13 and is a member of the Council of Europe.
^ Official website for Sandra Osborne
full.title: Sandra Osborne
